newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian '97 beet harvest seen flat or up on '96.
newsitem.headline: Russian '97 beet harvest seen flat or up on '96.

text.p: Russia's sugar beet harvest will equal or better last year's, Agriculture Minister Viktor Khlystun said on Friday.
"The area sown is a little smaller, but yields are better, so we will at least equal last year's level and, we hope, rise a little above it," he told a news conference. He gave no figures.
Russia planted 902,000 hectares to sugar beet this year, a 20 percent decline on 1996.

Ministry officials initially targeted beet output at 22 million tonnes, but industry analysts have said that goal is unrealistic. Last year's beet harvest was officially 16.1 million tonnes, far below 1995's 19.1 million.
